events.name: Severe Flooding and Mudslides Displace Thousands in South Africa
events.wd_label: Severe Flooding and Mudslides Displace Thousands in South Africa
events.wd_description: Severe flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and caused extensive damage, highlighting the increasing toll of climate change and the need for a stronger government response.
events.description: Severe flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and caused extensive damage, highlighting the increasing toll of climate change and the need for a stronger government response.

events.name: Displacement and Destruction in South Africa
events.wd_label: Displacement and Destruction in South Africa
events.wd_description: Flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and damaged approximately 8,300 others, with the nation mourning the loss and devastation.
events.description: Flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and damaged approximately 8,300 others, with the nation mourning the loss and devastation.

events.name: Impact of Climate Change on Vulnerable Communities
events.wd_label: Impact of Climate Change on Vulnerable Communities
events.wd_description: The flooding and mudslides are part of a series of powerful storms affecting southern and eastern Africa, underscoring the increasing toll of climate change on the most vulnerable communities.
events.description: The flooding and mudslides are part of a series of powerful storms affecting southern and eastern Africa, underscoring the increasing toll of climate change on the most vulnerable communities.

events.name: Call for Government Action
events.wd_description: Experts, including Jasper Knight, have emphasized the need for more aggressive government action in South Africa and other developing countries to protect vulnerable communities from the rising number of weather-related disasters.
events.description: Experts, including Jasper Knight, have emphasized the need for more aggressive government action in South Africa and other developing countries to protect vulnerable communities from the rising number of weather-related disasters.

events.name: Devastating flood in Kabul, May 2022
events.wd_description: A devastating flood in Kabul and 12 other provinces resulted in 22 deaths, 40 injuries, and widespread destruction of homes and crops amid an ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan.
events.description: A devastating flood in Kabul and 12 other provinces resulted in 22 deaths, 40 injuries, and widespread destruction of homes and crops amid an ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan.

events.name: Impact on Kabul and provinces
events.wd_description: The flood severely affected 12 provinces, with the worst impact in Badghis, Fyrab, and Baghlan, leading to 22 deaths, 40 injuries, destruction of 500 houses, and loss of 3000 acres of crops.
events.description: The flood severely affected 12 provinces, with the worst impact in Badghis, Fyrab, and Baghlan, leading to 22 deaths, 40 injuries, destruction of 500 houses, and loss of 3000 acres of crops.

events.name: Humanitarian crisis and response
events.wd_description: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan worsened due to the flood, with the Red Cross providing aid while the international community grapples with how to assist without legitimizing the Taliban.
events.description: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan worsened due to the flood, with the Red Cross providing aid while the international community grapples with how to assist without legitimizing the Taliban.

events.name: Ukraine secures release of 144 soldiers
events.wd_description: Ukraine secured the release of 144 soldiers, including 95 who defended the Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol, in the largest exchange of the crisis, while 144 Russian and separatist soldiers were returned to Russia.
events.description: Ukraine secured the release of 144 soldiers, including 95 who defended the Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol, in the largest exchange of the crisis, while 144 Russian and separatist soldiers were returned to Russia.

events.name: Details of the prisoner swap
events.wd_description: 144 Ukrainian soldiers were exchanged for 144 Russian and separatist soldiers, verified by a pro-Russian separatist leader.
events.description: 144 Ukrainian soldiers were exchanged for 144 Russian and separatist soldiers, verified by a pro-Russian separatist leader.

events.name: Political reactions in Russia
events.wd_description: Following the seizure of the Azov men, many Russian politicians advocated for their trial and death, with some members of the State Duma planning to introduce legislation to disrupt prisoner swaps involving fighters deemed "terrorists."
events.description: Following the seizure of the Azov men, many Russian politicians advocated for their trial and death, with some members of the State Duma planning to introduce legislation to disrupt prisoner swaps involving fighters deemed "terrorists."

events.name: Fate of Azovstal defenders
events.wd_description: More than a thousand Azovstal defenders who surrendered were moved to Russian-held territory in May, causing major concern for Kyiv's leaders who sought a prisoner swap.
events.description: More than a thousand Azovstal defenders who surrendered were moved to Russian-held territory in May, causing major concern for Kyiv's leaders who sought a prisoner swap.

events.name: Reactions to the exchange
events.wd_description: Some Russian military bloggers and pro-war politicians reacted negatively to the exchange plan, but Moscow did not respond to the prisoner swap.
events.description: Some Russian military bloggers and pro-war politicians reacted negatively to the exchange plan, but Moscow did not respond to the prisoner swap.

events.name: South Korean consortium invests in Indonesian EV supply chain
events.wd_label: South Korean consortium invests in Indonesian EV supply chain
events.wd_description: A South Korean consortium will invest $9bn in Indonesia to build a mines-to-manufacturing electric vehicle supply chain, aiming to reduce reliance on Chinese suppliers and mitigate commodity price rises.
events.description: A South Korean consortium will invest $9bn in Indonesia to build a mines-to-manufacturing electric vehicle supply chain, aiming to reduce reliance on Chinese suppliers and mitigate commodity price rises.

events.name: Agreement details
events.wd_description: The consortium, led by LG Energy Solution, has signed an agreement with local mining company PT Aneka Tamban (Antam) and Indonesia Battery Corporation to handle the entire battery production process.
events.description: The consortium, led by LG Energy Solution, has signed an agreement with local mining company PT Aneka Tamban (Antam) and Indonesia Battery Corporation to handle the entire battery production process.

events.name: Indonesia's nickel production
events.wd_description: Indonesia is the world's largest producer of nickel, with about 21mn tonnes of reserves according to US Geological Survey data.
events.description: Indonesia is the world's largest producer of nickel, with about 21mn tonnes of reserves according to US Geological Survey data.

events.name: Korean battery makers' investment
events.wd_description: South Korean battery makers have increased investment in EV battery chemicals and materials to reduce dependence on China, the world's biggest processor of necessary minerals.
events.description: South Korean battery makers have increased investment in EV battery chemicals and materials to reduce dependence on China, the world's biggest processor of necessary minerals.

events.name: Impact of Ukraine war
events.wd_description: The war in Ukraine has increased pressure to improve supply chain security, with Russia accounting for 11% of the world's nickel production and significant commodity price rises since the invasion.
events.description: The war in Ukraine has increased pressure to improve supply chain security, with Russia accounting for 11% of the world's nickel production and significant commodity price rises since the invasion.

events.name: Nickel price increase
events.wd_description: The London Metal Exchange's three-month nickel price has risen about 60% this year to $33,175 a tonne as of April 14, raising concern about battery makers' cost burden.
events.description: The London Metal Exchange's three-month nickel price has risen about 60% this year to $33,175 a tonne as of April 14, raising concern about battery makers' cost burden.

events.name: Auto industry's reliance on China
events.wd_description: The auto industry's transition from fossil fuel-powered vehicles is complicated by its reliance on Chinese refineries and factories, where about 80% of battery materials are processed.
events.description: The auto industry's transition from fossil fuel-powered vehicles is complicated by its reliance on Chinese refineries and factories, where about 80% of battery materials are processed.

events.name: Analyst's statement
events.wd_description: Yoon Hyuk-jin, an analyst at SK Securities, emphasized the importance of stable raw material supply for battery producers amid the Ukraine crisis, highlighting the need for upstream investments.
events.description: Yoon Hyuk-jin, an analyst at SK Securities, emphasized the importance of stable raw material supply for battery producers amid the Ukraine crisis, highlighting the need for upstream investments.

events.name: Consortium members
events.wd_description: The consortium includes LG Chem, Posco, LX International, and Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt.
events.description: The consortium includes LG Chem, Posco, LX International, and Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt.

events.name: LGES statement
events.wd_description: LGES expects the project to improve battery business capability and profitability by securing competitive raw materials in a stable manner.
events.description: LGES expects the project to improve battery business capability and profitability by securing competitive raw materials in a stable manner.

events.name: LGES and Hyundai joint venture
events.wd_description: LGES is also building a $1.1bn battery cell plant in Karawang Regency, Indonesia, as part of a joint venture with Hyundai Motor group.
events.description: LGES is also building a $1.1bn battery cell plant in Karawang Regency, Indonesia, as part of a joint venture with Hyundai Motor group.

events.name: CATL's similar project
events.wd_description: The consortium's investment was announced days after CATL signed a $6bn deal with Indonesian companies including Antam to produce a similar project.
events.description: The consortium's investment was announced days after CATL signed a $6bn deal with Indonesian companies including Antam to produce a similar project.
